body:
It appears nginx returns: `content-range: bytes */<filesize>` in this case. For example Apache2 doesn't include the `content-range` header for `416` response.

This seems to fix this issue, but I am not entirely sure if this is the best way to fix it:
```
diff --git a/lib/http.c b/lib/http.c
index ee31aa2c6..caa3d50a1 100644
--- a/lib/http.c
+++ b/lib/http.c
@@ -3476,7 +3476,7 @@ CURLcode Curl_http_header(struct Curl_easy *data, struct connectdata *conn,
           k->content_range = TRUE;
       }
     }
-    else
+    else if(416 != k->httpcode)
       data->state.resume_from = 0; /* get everything */
   }
 #if !defined(CURL_DISABLE_COOKIES)
```
Comments are welcome.

issue.title: http: ignore content-range for 416 responses

issue.title: curl: update to 7.88.1:
issue.body:
- patch has been removed as the fix is already in the source code.
 - sha256 updated.
 - dependencies in the host section pinned.
 - enriched licence info. 
 
 As part of the task also:

1.  Checked the upstream and it seems nothing has changed in terms of dependencies:
  https://github.com/curl/curl
2. Checked the changelog:
  https://curl.se/changes.html
3. Verified urls.
5. Checked known issues:
  https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/10704. (seems to have a solution)
  https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/10694. (seems to have a solution)

body:
I run into this problem as well. I tried running `curl -C -` to download a build artifact from an [artifactory](https://jfrog.com/de/artifactory/) server, hoping that repeated script runs would not download the large file multiple times.

The server replies with 
```
HTTP/1.1 416 Requested Range Not Satisfiable
Connection: keep-alive
Content-Length: 0
Content-Range: bytes */977880575
Date: Wed, 09 Aug 2023 09:57:07 GMT
Server: nginx/1.18.0 (Ubuntu)
X-Artifactory-Id: ***redacted***
X-Artifactory-Node-Id: ***redacted***
X-Jfrog-Version: Artifactory/7.55.13 75513900
```
and curl fails (exit code 22).

As I am not familiar with the curl codebase, I have problems reviewing the change in #10644 and do not yet understand what is the problem with it.

issue.title: Curl is failing when downloading a already downloaded file with resume download and --fail error set

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
### I did this

I tried to download a file and it got downloaded and then again i tried to download with resume download and --fail. 

# ran it twice
curl -O -C - -f "https://github.com/robots.txt"
curl -O -C - -f "https://github.com/robots.txt"

### I expected the following

curl: (22) The requested URL returned error: 416

The above was the error recieved which shouldn,t have happened as this was fixed already in https://github.com/curl/curl/issues/6740 as part of Fixed in 7.76.0 - March 31 2021 release

### curl/libcurl version

curl 7.88.1 (x86_64-pc-linux-gnu) libcurl/7.88.1 OpenSSL/3.0.8 zlib/1.2.13 brotli/1.0.9 zstd/1.5.4 libidn2/2.3.3 libpsl/0.21.2 (+libidn2/2.3.3) libssh/0.10.4/openssl/zlib nghttp2/1.52.0 librtmp/2.3
Release-Date: 2023-02-20
Protocols: dict file ftp ftps gopher gophers http https imap imaps ldap ldaps mqtt pop3 pop3s rtmp rtsp scp sftp smb smbs smtp smtps telnet tftp
Features: alt-svc AsynchDNS brotli GSS-API HSTS HTTP2 HTTPS-proxy IDN IPv6 Kerberos Largefile libz NTLM NTLM_WB PSL SPNEGO SSL threadsafe TLS-SRP UnixSockets zstd


### operating system

Linux ar 6.2.0-34-generic #34-Ubuntu SMP PREEMPT_DYNAMIC Mon Sep  4 13:06:55 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux

issue.title: http: consider resume with CURLOPT_FAILONERRROR and 416 to be fine

repository.name: curl
repository.description: A command line tool and library for transferring data with URL syntax, supporting DICT, FILE, FTP, FTPS, GOPHER, GOPHERS, HTTP, HTTPS, IMAP, IMAPS, LDAP, LDAPS, MQTT, POP3, POP3S, RTMP, RTMPS, RTSP, SCP, SFTP, SMB, SMBS, SMTP, SMTPS, TELNET, TFTP, WS and WSS. libcurl offers a myriad of powerful features

issue.body:
Finding a 'Content-Range:' in the response changed the handling.

Add test case 1475 to verify -C - with 416 and Content-Range: header, which is almost exactly like test 194 which instead uses a fixed -C offset. Adjusted test 194 to also be considered fine.

Fixes #10521
Reported-by: Smackd0wn
Fixes #12174
Reported-by: Anubhav Rai
